content:
You are visiting San Francisco for the day and want to meet as many friends as possible. Solve the problem by considering various different schedules and picking the best one to optimize your goals.

Travel distances (in minutes):
North Beach to Pacific Heights: 8.
North Beach to Chinatown: 6.
North Beach to Union Square: 7.
North Beach to Mission District: 18.
North Beach to Golden Gate Park: 22.
North Beach to Nob Hill: 7.
Pacific Heights to North Beach: 9.
Pacific Heights to Chinatown: 11.
Pacific Heights to Union Square: 12.
Pacific Heights to Mission District: 15.
Pacific Heights to Golden Gate Park: 15.
Pacific Heights to Nob Hill: 8.
Chinatown to North Beach: 3.
Chinatown to Pacific Heights: 10.
Chinatown to Union Square: 7.
Chinatown to Mission District: 18.
Chinatown to Golden Gate Park: 23.
Chinatown to Nob Hill: 8.
Union Square to North Beach: 10.
Union Square to Pacific Heights: 15.
Union Square to Chinatown: 7.
Union Square to Mission District: 14.
Union Square to Golden Gate Park: 22.
Union Square to Nob Hill: 9.
Mission District to North Beach: 17.
Mission District to Pacific Heights: 16.
Mission District to Chinatown: 16.
Mission District to Union Square: 15.
Mission District to Golden Gate Park: 17.
Mission District to Nob Hill: 12.
Golden Gate Park to North Beach: 24.
Golden Gate Park to Pacific Heights: 16.
Golden Gate Park to Chinatown: 23.
Golden Gate Park to Union Square: 22.
Golden Gate Park to Mission District: 17.
Golden Gate Park to Nob Hill: 20.
Nob Hill to North Beach: 8.
Nob Hill to Pacific Heights: 8.
Nob Hill to Chinatown: 6.
Nob Hill to Union Square: 7.
Nob Hill to Mission District: 13.
Nob Hill to Golden Gate Park: 17.

CONSTRAINTS: You arrive at North Beach at 9:00AM. James will be at Pacific Heights from 8:00PM to 10:00PM. You'd like to meet James for a minimum of 120 minutes. Robert will be at Chinatown from 12:15PM to 4:45PM. You'd like to meet Robert for a minimum of 90 minutes. Jeffrey will be at Union Square from 9:30AM to 3:30PM. You'd like to meet Jeffrey for a minimum of 120 minutes. Carol will be at Mission District from 6:15PM to 9:15PM. You'd like to meet Carol for a minimum of 15 minutes. Mark will be at Golden Gate Park from 11:30AM to 5:45PM. You'd like to meet Mark for a minimum of 15 minutes. Sandra will be at Nob Hill from 8:00AM to 3:30PM. You'd like to meet Sandra for a minimum of 15 minutes.

Your response should start with 'SOLUTION:'.

Please output the meeting schedule in the following JSON format:
{"itinerary": [{"action": "meet", "person": "<PERSON_NAME>", "start_time": "<HH:MM>", "end_time": "<HH:MM>"}]}. Make sure to include the person's name for each meeting.

SOLUTION: 

To optimize the schedule and meet as many friends as possible while satisfying the minimum meeting durations, we need to consider the travel times and the availability windows of each friend. Here's the optimal schedule:

1. Start at North Beach at 9:00 AM.
2. Meet Jeffrey at Union Square first, as he is available from 9:30 AM and requires a long meeting (120 minutes). Travel time from North Beach to Union Square is 7 minutes, so arrive at 9:07 AM. Start meeting at 9:30 AM (when Jeffrey is available) until 11:30 AM.
3. Next, meet Mark at Golden Gate Park. Travel time from Union Square to Golden Gate Park is 22 minutes, so arrive at 11:52 AM. Mark is available until 5:45 PM, so meet from 11:52 AM to 12:07 PM (15 minutes minimum).
4. Next, meet Robert at Chinatown. Travel time from Golden Gate Park to Chinatown is 23 minutes, so arrive at 12:30 PM. Robert is available until 4:45 PM, so meet from 12:30 PM to 2:00 PM (90 minutes minimum).
5. Next, meet Sandra at Nob Hill. Travel time from Chinatown to Nob Hill is 8 minutes, so arrive at 2:08 PM. Sandra is available until 3:30 PM, so meet from 2:08 PM to 2:23 PM (15 minutes minimum).
6. Next, meet Carol at Mission District. Travel time from Nob Hill to Mission District is 13 minutes, so arrive at 2:36 PM. Carol is not available until 6:15 PM, so this is not possible. Instead, we can adjust the schedule to meet Carol later.
7. After meeting Sandra, we can wait until Carol is available. The next available friend is James at Pacific Heights from 8:00 PM. Travel time from Nob Hill to Pacific Heights is 8 minutes, so arrive at 2:31 PM. But James is not available until 8:00 PM, so this doesn't work. Instead, we can meet Carol at Mission District from 6:15 PM. Travel time from Nob Hill to Mission District is 13 minutes, so leave Nob Hill at 6:02 PM to arrive at 6:15 PM. Meet Carol from 6:15 PM to 6:30 PM (15 minutes minimum).
8. Finally, meet James at Pacific Heights. Travel time from Mission District to Pacific Heights is 16 minutes, so leave Mission District at 7:44 PM to arrive at 8:00 PM. Meet James from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM (120 minutes minimum).

Here is the schedule in JSON format:

```json
{
  "itinerary": [
    {
      "action": "meet",
      "person": "Jeffrey",
      "start_time": "09:30",
      "end_time": "11:30"
    },
    {
      "action": "meet",
      "person": "Mark",
      "start_time": "11:52",
      "end_time": "12:07"
    },
    {
      "action": "meet",
      "person": "Robert",
      "start_time": "12:30",
      "end_time": "14:00"
    },
    {
      "action": "meet",
      "person": "Sandra",
      "start_time": "14:08",
      "end_time": "14:23"
    },
    {
      "action": "meet",
      "person": "Carol",
      "start_time": "18:15",
      "end_time": "18:30"
    },
    {
      "action": "meet",
      "person": "James",
      "start_time": "20:00",
      "end_time": "22:00"
    }
  ]
}
```

This schedule meets all friends while satisfying the minimum meeting durations and travel constraints.
